questions.question_text: How is a macro referenced in a search?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Macro is use with backtick (the key above the Tap on your keyboard).

Selected Answer: D
Or this for Splunk Enterprise https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Knowledge/Usesearchmacros

choices.D: By enclosing the macro name in backtick characters (').
choices.B: By enclosing the macro name in single-quote characters (').

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This question was taken straight from the documentation. 

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Knowledge/Abouteventtypes#How_event_types_work

questions.question_text: Which search string would only return results for an event type called successful_purchases?
In the Field Extractor, when would the regular expression method be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The choice of the term "unstructured" is interesting to put it mildly, but...

Quote: "The regular expression method works best with unstructured event data."
Ref: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Knowledge/ExtractfieldsinteractivelywithIFX
Version 9.2.0 is latest as of writing.

choices.A: They can only be added into a root search dataset.
choices.D: They cannot be edited if inherited from a parent dataset.
choices.B: They cannot be created within the data model.
choices.C: They can be added to a dataset from search time field extractions.

discussion.content:
The answer is D.

while you could add attributes to different levels of datasets within a data model hierarchy, if you inherited an attribute from a parent dataset, you typically cannot directly modify it within a child dataset.

Splunk knowledge managers design and maintain data models. These knowledge managers understand the format and semantics of their indexed data and are familiar with the Splunk search language. In building a typical data model, knowledge managers use knowledge object types such as lookups, transactions, search-time field extractions, and calculated fields.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is true about data model attributes?
Which of the following knowledge objects represents the output of an eval expression?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The knowledge object that represents the output of an eval expression in Splunk is typically referred to as "Calculated fields." When you use the eval command in Splunk, you are creating new fields or modifying existing fields based on expressions or calculations. These calculated fields can be used in searches, reports, and dashboards to analyze and visualize data in different ways.
b is the correct answer, f2 - p188
